result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick Timothy Dietz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick Timothy Dietz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order for income withholding recieved and filed.

State appeared by Patrick Anderson.  Defendant Patrick Dietz appeared with his attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 1 day credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 1 YEAR probation.
  Conditions of Probation:
- No further violations rising to the level of probable cause
- Cooperate with the Probation Department
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary
- 25 hours of community service
- No possession of alcohol or illegal drugs
- Random urine screens
- Seek and maintain full-time employment 
- Write a letter of apology to ****  within 30 days
- Provide a DNA sample.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
No restitution on this matter
Pay DNA surcharges;
Pay all court costs
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges are due an owing within 30 days of the revocation to convert to a civil judgment

Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Filed:   
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
received and filed

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.

Defendant Patrick Timothy Dietz in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Patrick Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  On State's motion Court ordered Count 1 amended the charge to Theft, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(a), a Class A misdemeanor.   Original amended information to be filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Patrick Timothy Dietz in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests projected guilty plea date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Patrick Timothy Dietz in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Ronald Dague for Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Stayed Bench Warrant is withdrawn.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 6/23/15.
css

Defendant Patrick Timothy Dietz not in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Joanne Hardtke for Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defense Counsel is requesting an adjournment regarding defendant's health issue.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next scheduled court date.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 6/12/15.
css
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 06-15-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Patrick Timothy Dietz in court with Attorney Greg Renden, appearing for Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Ronald Dague, appearing for Patrick J Anderson, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Carpenter unable to appear in court on today's date.  Defense counsel failing to appear, Court released police officer at 3:30 p.m.
Defense counsel informs Court that defendant is requesting a hearing.

Court orders case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Heather S or her residence
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Patrick Timothy Dietz in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Patrick Timothy Dietz in custody.  
Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
